title: Englishpod 初级 英文播客 0281

segments.en: Hello, everyone, and welcome to EnglishPod.
segments.cn: 大家好，欢迎来到EnglishPod。

segments.en: My name is Marco.
segments.cn: 我叫Marco。

segments.en: My name is Katherine, and we've got a very sad dialogue today, actually, Marco.
segments.cn: 我叫Katherine，今天我们有一个非常悲伤的对话，实际上，Marco。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: Today we have a very sad but interesting dialogue of something that happens all the time.
segments.cn: 今天我们有一个非常悲伤但有趣的对话，关于经常发生的事情。

segments.en: Maybe you have a girlfriend, maybe you had a boyfriend, and you break up.
segments.cn: 也许你有女朋友，也许你有男朋友，然后你们分手了。

segments.en: That means you are no longer boyfriend and girlfriend.
segments.cn: 这意味着你们不再是男女朋友。

segments.en: Let's take a listen to today's dialogue, and we'll be back in a moment to talk about what's going on.
segments.cn: 让我们来听听今天的对话，稍后我们会回来讨论发生了什么。

segments.en: Hello?
segments.cn: 你好？

segments.en: Hey, do you want to go out tonight?
segments.cn: 嘿，你今晚想出去吗？

segments.en: No, I think I'll pass.
segments.cn: 不，我想我就不去了。

segments.en: Mark broke up with me.
segments.cn: Mark和我分手了。

segments.en: I feel awful.
segments.cn: 我感觉很糟糕。

segments.en: What?
segments.cn: 什么？

segments.en: What happened?
segments.cn: 发生了什么？

segments.en: Just last week you were talking about going on vacation together.
segments.cn: 就在上周你还在谈论一起去度假呢。

segments.en: I don't know what I did wrong.
segments.cn: 我不知道我做错了什么。

segments.en: He said he needed some space to figure things out.
segments.cn: 他说他需要一些空间来理清事情。

segments.en: He said I didn't do anything wrong, that I'm a great person, just not the one for him.
segments.cn: 他说我没有做错任何事，我是个好人，只是对他来说不是合适的人。

segments.en: That's so cliche.
segments.cn: 这太老套了。

segments.en: Mark's not worth your time, Lydia.
segments.cn: Mark不值得你浪费时间，Lydia。

segments.en: You deserve so much better.
segments.cn: 你值得更好的。

segments.en: I know we had hit a rough patch, but I had hoped we could work it out next weekend when we both had some time off.
segments.cn: 我知道我们经历了一段困难时期，但我希望我们下周末能解决这个问题，当我们都有时间的时候。

segments.en: I think he found someone else.
segments.cn: 我想他找到了其他人。

segments.en: I had been getting suspicious because he had been spending a lot of time with a co-worker.
segments.cn: 我开始怀疑，因为他和一个同事花了很多时间在一起。

segments.en: Whatever.
segments.cn: 随便吧。

segments.en: He's a jerk.
segments.cn: 他是个混蛋。

segments.en: Forget about him.
segments.cn: 忘了他吧。

segments.en: There are many more fish in the sea.
segments.cn: 海里还有很多鱼。

segments.en: Talk about being cliche, Maggie.
segments.cn: 说到老套，Maggie。

segments.en: But you're right.
segments.cn: 但你说得对。

segments.en: There's no use for me to sulk around.
segments.cn: 我没必要一直闷闷不乐。

segments.en: Let's go out tonight.
segments.cn: 今晚我们出去吧。

segments.en: Alright, we're back.
segments.cn: 好的，我们回来了。

segments.en: So obviously this girl Lydia is very torn.
segments.cn: 显然这个女孩Lydia非常痛苦。

segments.en: She's very sad because her boyfriend broke up with her.
segments.cn: 她很伤心，因为她的男朋友和她分手了。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: She's crying the whole time this dialogue is going on.
segments.cn: 在整个对话中她一直在哭。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: But she did mention... her and her friend mentioned some interesting things.
segments.cn: 但她提到……她和她的朋友提到了一些有趣的事情。

segments.en: Why don't we take a look at some of the words they used on Language Takeaway.
segments.cn: 我们来看看他们在Language Takeaway中使用的一些词汇。

segments.en: So first of all, her friend says, Hey, do you want to go out tonight?
segments.cn: 首先，她的朋友说，嘿，你今晚想出去吗？

segments.en: And what does Lydia say?
segments.cn: Lydia怎么说？

segments.en: She says, No, I think I'll pass.
segments.cn: 她说，不，我想我就不去了。

segments.en: Alright, I think I'll pass.
segments.cn: 好吧，我想我就不去了。

segments.en: I will pass.
segments.cn: 我会不去。

segments.en: So what does this verb mean, to pass?
segments.cn: 那么这个动词“pass”是什么意思？

segments.en: So that means she is politely rejecting the offer or the invitation.
segments.cn: 这意味着她在礼貌地拒绝这个提议或邀请。

segments.en: So, no thanks.
segments.cn: 所以，不用了。

segments.en: No thanks.
segments.cn: 不用了。

segments.en: That's basically what it means.
segments.cn: 这基本上就是它的意思。

segments.en: I won't go.
segments.cn: 我不去。

segments.en: So, hey Marco, you want to go see a movie in a couple hours?
segments.cn: 所以，嘿Marco，你想在几个小时后去看电影吗？

segments.en: No, I think I'll pass.
segments.cn: 不，我想我就不去了。

segments.en: I got homework to do.
segments.cn: 我有作业要做。

segments.en: Alright, so Marco will not come.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以Marco不会来了。

segments.en: That means to decline an invitation.
segments.cn: 这意味着拒绝一个邀请。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So that's what it means to pass.
segments.cn: 所以这就是“pass”的意思。

segments.en: Now, as they continue to talk, they mention some of the problems with their boyfriend, but Maggie said, Ugh, that's so cliche.
segments.cn: 现在，当他们继续交谈时，他们提到了一些与男朋友有关的问题，但Maggie说，唉，这太老套了。

segments.en: So the boyfriend said something and Maggie thinks that what he said was very, very cliche.
segments.cn: 所以男朋友说了一些话，Maggie认为他说的非常老套。

segments.en: So what is something that is cliche?
segments.cn: 那么什么是老套的东西？

segments.en: Cliche means something that is said or done very often.
segments.cn: 老套意味着某些事情被说或做得非常频繁。

segments.en: It's almost like we would expect it.
segments.cn: 这几乎是我们会期待的。

segments.en: So like, for example, what's a cliche phrase or a cliche action?
segments.cn: 所以，比如说，什么是老套的短语或老套的行为？

segments.en: Well, in the dialogue, they were talking about ways of breaking up with people.
segments.cn: 嗯，在对话中，他们在谈论与人分手的方式。

segments.en: So, for example, it's not you, it's me, let's break up.
segments.cn: 所以，例如，“不是你，是我，我们分手吧。”

segments.en: So that's a cliche because it's a sentence, it's a phrase everyone always says.
segments.cn: 这就是一个老套，因为这是每个人总是说的句子。

segments.en: It's not very, maybe not very honest.
segments.cn: 这不是很，可能不是很诚实。

segments.en: Or like a movie cliche would be, you know, a couple, they're getting married, but their parents, the parents of the bride, they're divorced, they hate each other.
segments.cn: 或者像电影老套就是，你知道，一对情侣，他们要结婚，但新娘的父母离婚了，他们互相厌恶。

segments.en: But then at the wedding, they get back together, they're going to get married again.
segments.cn: 但在婚礼上，他们又复合了，他们要再结婚。

segments.en: That's a cliche story.
segments.cn: 这是一个老套的故事。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: Because you've heard it before.
segments.cn: 因为你以前听过。

segments.en: Right, all the time.
segments.cn: 对，随时都在。

segments.en: It's very common.
segments.cn: 这很常见。

segments.en: So something that's very common, something that you would expect, that's almost, that's a cliche.
segments.cn: 所以一些非常常见的东西，几乎是你会期待的，那就是老套。

segments.en: And a cliche, calling something a cliche is not a good thing.
segments.cn: 而称某事为老套并不是一件好事。

segments.en: It's usually a bad thing.
segments.cn: 通常是坏事。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: Okay, so Maggie goes on to say that, you know, this guy Mark, her ex-boyfriend, he's not really worth it.
segments.cn: 好吧，Maggie接着说，你知道，这个家伙Mark，她的前男友，真的不值得。

segments.en: She says, you deserve so much better.
segments.cn: 她说，你值得更好的。

segments.en: Okay, so to deserve is a verb, and it means that you should receive something or you should expect something.
segments.cn: 好吧，值得是一个动词，意味着你应该得到某物或你应该期待某物。

segments.en: So almost like, you know, in this case, you deserve better.
segments.cn: 所以几乎就像，在这种情况下，你值得更好的。

segments.en: You have earned something better.
segments.cn: 你应得更好的东西。

segments.en: You're a good person.
segments.cn: 你是个好人。

segments.en: You should receive, you know, you should have a good boyfriend.
segments.cn: 你应该得到，你知道，你应该有一个好男朋友。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So when she says you deserve so much better, she's talking about deserving a better guy, a better man.
segments.cn: 所以当她说你值得更好的时，她是在谈论值得一个更好的男人。

segments.en: Or for example, so Marco, you work so hard at school.
segments.cn: 或者例如，Marco，你在学校工作得很努力。

segments.en: You're always doing your homework.
segments.cn: 你总是在做作业。

segments.en: You really deserve good grades.
segments.cn: 你真的值得好成绩。

segments.en: You should receive good grades.
segments.cn: 你应该得到好成绩。

segments.en: Very good.
segments.cn: 非常好。

segments.en: Now, when Lydia said, yeah, you know what, I just thought we were having some problems.
segments.cn: 现在，当Lydia说，是的，你知道吗，我只是觉得我们有一些问题。

segments.en: And we had hit a rough patch.
segments.cn: 我们经历了一段困难时期。

segments.en: So she's talking about a rough patch.
segments.cn: 她在谈论一个困难时期。

segments.en: What is that?
segments.cn: 那是什么？

segments.en: A rough patch is actually something we talk about a lot in spoken English.
segments.cn: 困难时期实际上是我们在口语英语中经常谈论的事情。

segments.en: It's a way to describe a period of time, so maybe a week or a month, when things are difficult.
segments.cn: 这是描述一段时间的方式，也许是一周或一个月，当事情很困难。

segments.en: You know, when maybe you argue with your boyfriend or girlfriend or when you're sad a lot or when you're confused.
segments.cn: 你知道的，当你和你的男朋友或女朋友争吵，或者你经常感到悲伤，或者你感到困惑的时候。

segments.en: And so a period of time when you're angry or sad with your boyfriend or girlfriend, that's a rough patch.
segments.cn: 所以当你对你的男朋友或女朋友感到愤怒或悲伤的那段时间，就是困难时期。

segments.en: So maybe we can apply a rough patch to another situation like at work.
segments.cn: 所以也许我们可以把困难时期应用到工作等其他情况。

segments.en: Maybe you're going through a rough patch at work.
segments.cn: 也许你在工作中经历了一段困难时期。

segments.en: That means I'm always busy.
segments.cn: 这意味着我总是很忙。

segments.en: I'm always tired.
segments.cn: 我总是很累。

segments.en: I don't feel happy with my job.
segments.cn: 我对我的工作不满意。

segments.en: I'm going through a rough patch.
segments.cn: 我正在经历一段困难时期。

segments.en: So it's usually a temporary period of time where things are going bad.
segments.cn: 所以这通常是一个暂时的时期，事情进展不顺。

segments.en: It could be a week.
segments.cn: 可能是一周。

segments.en: It could be a month.
segments.cn: 可能是一个月。

segments.en: It could be a year.
segments.cn: 可能是一年。

segments.en: But it's a fixed amount of time.
segments.cn: 但这是一个固定的时间段。

segments.en: It's not forever.
segments.cn: 这不是永远的。

segments.en: It's just a period.
segments.cn: 这只是一个时期。

segments.en: Okay, very good.
segments.cn: 好的，非常好。

segments.en: And Lydia went on to say that she thought that maybe he was going out with someone else.
segments.cn: 然后莉迪亚继续说她觉得他可能和其他人约会。

segments.en: And she was suspicious because he was spending a lot of time with some other girl.
segments.cn: 她感到怀疑，因为他花了很多时间和其他女孩在一起。

segments.en: Okay, so to be suspicious is to think that something is happening.
segments.cn: 好的，所以怀疑就是认为某事正在发生。

segments.en: But you don't know.
segments.cn: 但你不知道。

segments.en: So for example, Marco, I think you've been taking the milk from the kitchen.
segments.cn: 比如，马尔科，我觉得你一直在从厨房拿牛奶。

segments.en: You are always drinking coffee and you always take milk in your coffee and there's no more milk.
segments.cn: 你总是喝咖啡，而且你总是在咖啡里加牛奶，但没有牛奶了。

segments.en: So I think it was you.
segments.cn: 所以我觉得是你。

segments.en: I'm being suspicious.
segments.cn: 我在怀疑。

segments.en: I'm thinking that maybe you did something bad or wrong.
segments.cn: 我在想，也许你做了什么坏事或错误的事情。

segments.en: That I'm guilty.
segments.cn: 我有罪。

segments.en: So maybe you're suspicious that someone is stealing the milk.
segments.cn: 所以也许你怀疑有人在偷牛奶。

segments.en: Or maybe you suspect or you're suspicious that your next door neighbor is maybe a car thief.
segments.cn: 或者你怀疑你的邻居可能是个偷车贼。

segments.en: Right, so you're very suspicious.
segments.cn: 对，所以你非常怀疑。

segments.en: That means you're always thinking that this person or someone else is doing something bad.
segments.cn: 这意味着你总是在想这个人或其他人正在做坏事。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: Okay, so a lot of words there talking about relationships, talking about clichés.
segments.cn: 好的，所以有很多词在谈论关系，谈论陈词滥调。

segments.en: Why don't we go back?
segments.cn: 我们为什么不回去？

segments.en: Let's listen to the dialogue again and we'll be back in a bit with Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 让我们再听一遍对话，稍后我们将回到流利度提升。

segments.en: Hello?
segments.cn: 你好？

segments.en: Hey, do you want to go out tonight?
segments.cn: 嘿，你今晚想出去吗？

segments.en: No, I think I'll pass.
segments.cn: 不，我想我就不去了。

segments.en: Mark broke up with me.
segments.cn: 马克和我分手了。

segments.en: I feel awful.
segments.cn: 我感觉很糟糕。

segments.en: What?
segments.cn: 什么？

segments.en: What happened?
segments.cn: 发生了什么？

segments.en: Just last week you were talking about going on vacation together.
segments.cn: 就在上周你还在谈论一起去度假。

segments.en: I don't know what I did wrong.
segments.cn: 我不知道我做错了什么。

segments.en: He said he needed some space to figure things out.
segments.cn: 他说他需要一些空间来理清事情。

segments.en: He said I didn't do anything wrong, that I'm a great person, just not the one for him.
segments.cn: 他说我没有做错任何事，我是个好人，只是对他来说不是合适的人。

segments.en: That's so cliché.
segments.cn: 这太陈词滥调了。

segments.en: Mark's not worth your time, Lydia.
segments.cn: 马克不值得你花时间，莉迪亚。

segments.en: You deserve so much better.
segments.cn: 你值得更好的。

segments.en: I know we had hit a rough patch, but I had hoped we could work it out next weekend when we both had some time off.
segments.cn: 我知道我们经历了一段困难时期，但我希望我们下周末能解决这个问题，当我们都有时间休息的时候。

segments.en: I think he found someone else.
segments.cn: 我觉得他找到了其他人。

segments.en: I had been getting suspicious because he had been spending a lot of time with a co-worker.
segments.cn: 我一直在怀疑，因为他花了很多时间和一个同事在一起。

segments.en: Whatever.
segments.cn: 随便吧。

segments.en: He's a jerk.
segments.cn: 他是个混蛋。

segments.en: Forget about him.
segments.cn: 忘了他吧。

segments.en: There are many more fish in the sea.
segments.cn: 海里还有很多鱼。

segments.en: Talk about being cliché, Maggie.
segments.cn: 说到陈词滥调，玛吉。

segments.en: But you're right.
segments.cn: 但你是对的。

segments.en: There's no use for me to sulk around.
segments.cn: 我没有必要闷闷不乐。

segments.en: Let's go out tonight.
segments.cn: 我们今晚出去吧。

segments.en: Alright, we're back.
segments.cn: 好的，我们回来了。

segments.en: So now let's take a look at some of those phrases on Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 现在让我们看看流利度提升中的一些短语。

segments.en: Fluency Builder Alright, so Marco, these are cliché phrases that we hear in English when people are breaking up.
segments.cn: 流利度提升 好的，马尔科，这些是我们在英语中听到的关于分手的陈词滥调短语。

segments.en: So there's some breaking up phrases, but there's also phrases that you might hear from your friend after you have a breakup.
segments.cn: 所以有一些分手短语，但也有一些你可能在分手后从朋友那里听到的短语。

segments.en: The first phrase we're going to look at, I think, is to need space.
segments.cn: 我们要看的第一个短语是需要空间。

segments.en: So he said he needed some space.
segments.cn: 所以他说他需要一些空间。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: And that's a cliché phrase, as we said, but it means that maybe her ex-boyfriend or Mark needs more space.
segments.cn: 这是一句陈词滥调，正如我们所说，但这意味着也许她的前男友或马克需要更多的空间。

segments.en: Needs more time to be on his own or needs more time to do his own things.
segments.cn: 需要更多的时间来独处或做自己的事情。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So when you're in a relationship, you have a boyfriend or a girlfriend, you're always together.
segments.cn: 所以当你在一段关系中，有一个男朋友或女朋友时，你总是在一起。

segments.en: I need some space means I want to be alone.
segments.cn: 我需要一些空间意味着我想独处。

segments.en: I don't want to be with my boyfriend or girlfriend.
segments.cn: 我不想和我的男朋友或女朋友在一起。

segments.en: Sometimes this is just a small period.
segments.cn: 有时这只是一个短暂的时期。

segments.en: Sometimes it's forever.
segments.cn: 有时是永远。

segments.en: It depends.
segments.cn: 这要看情况。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So when somebody says that they need space, it means they need a little bit of more time to be on their own or to be alone, as you said.
segments.cn: 所以当有人说他们需要空间时，这意味着他们需要更多的时间独处，或者如你所说，想要独处。

segments.en: And also, he had also given her another cliché phrase.
segments.cn: 而且，他还给了她另一个陈词滥调短语。

segments.en: Mark said that she is not the one for him.
segments.cn: 马克说她不是他想要的人。

segments.en: Okay, so the emphasis here is the one.
segments.cn: 好的，所以这里的重点是“那个人”。

segments.en: She's not the one for him.
segments.cn: 她不是他想要的人。

segments.en: So in English, we often talk about the one, and this means the person that you will marry, the love of your life.
segments.cn: 所以在英语中，我们经常谈论“那个人”，这意味着你将要结婚的人，生命中的挚爱。

segments.en: Your significant other, your other half.
segments.cn: 你的另一半，你的另一半。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: And so you hope that you will marry the one, but her boyfriend realized.
segments.cn: 所以你希望能和“那个人”结婚，但她的男朋友意识到。

segments.en: He said, listen, I like you, but you're not the one.
segments.cn: 他说，听着，我喜欢你，但你不是“那个人”。

segments.en: You're not the person that I will marry.
segments.cn: 你不是我会结婚的人。

segments.en: So this is a phrase you often hear in breakup.
segments.cn: 所以这是你在分手时经常听到的短语。

segments.en: So if you're single, maybe you don't have a boyfriend or you're not married, you might say that you haven't found the one.
segments.cn: 所以如果你是单身，也许你没有男朋友或没有结婚，你可能会说你还没有找到“那个人”。

segments.en: Or yeah, you have a lot of different boyfriends, but you still haven't found the one.
segments.cn: 或者是的，你有很多不同的男朋友，但你仍然没有找到“那个人”。

segments.en: That means the one you will marry.
segments.cn: 这意味着你将要结婚的人。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: Okay, very good.
segments.cn: 好的，非常好。

segments.en: And now towards the end of the dialogue, Maggie also gives her some advice and said, you know what?
segments.cn: 然后在对话的最后，玛吉也给了她一些建议，说，你知道吗？

segments.en: Forget about him.
segments.cn: 忘了他吧。

segments.en: There are many more fish in the sea.
segments.cn: 海里还有很多鱼。

segments.en: Okay, so this is a phrase that we often say when we're trying to make somebody feel better.
segments.cn: 好的，这是一句我们常说的话，当我们想让某人感觉好些的时候。

segments.en: So the person is sad and we want to make them happy.
segments.cn: 所以这个人很伤心，我们想让他们快乐。

segments.en: And so there are many more fish in the sea means that there are other men in the world.
segments.cn: 所以“海里还有很多鱼”意味着世界上还有其他男人。

segments.en: Okay, you're sad.
segments.cn: 好吧，你很伤心。

segments.en: You broke up.
segments.cn: 你分手了。

segments.en: I understand.
segments.cn: 我明白。

segments.en: But there are so many other men you could date.
segments.cn: 但你可以约会很多其他男人。

segments.en: So she's trying to say, hey, listen, look at this world.
segments.cn: 所以她想说，嘿，听着，看看这个世界。

segments.en: There's so many different options.
segments.cn: 有很多不同的选择。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So it's the similarity of how in the sea you have so many fish, in the world you have so many men, so don't worry about it.
segments.cn: 所以就像海里有很多鱼，世界上有很多男人，所以别担心。

segments.en: And you can say this about women too.
segments.cn: 你也可以这样说关于女人。

segments.en: So, for example, if I'm talking to my male friend or my brother and my brother just broke up with his girlfriend, I can say, hey, listen, there are many more fish in the sea, many other women.
segments.cn: 比如说，如果我在和我的男性朋友或我的兄弟谈话，而我的兄弟刚和他的女朋友分手，我可以说，嘿，听着，海里还有很多鱼，很多其他女人。

segments.en: So don't worry about it.
segments.cn: 所以别担心。

segments.en: Don't worry about it.
segments.cn: 别担心。

segments.en: You'll be okay.
segments.cn: 你会没事的。

segments.en: And Lydia says, you know what?
segments.cn: 然后莉迪亚说，你知道吗？

segments.en: I think you're right.
segments.cn: 我觉得你说得对。

segments.en: And there's really no use for me to sulk around.
segments.cn: 我真的没有必要闷闷不乐。

segments.en: So what does she mean to sulk around?
segments.cn: 那么她说“闷闷不乐”是什么意思？

segments.en: To sulk.
segments.cn: 闷闷不乐。

segments.en: Now, this is something that is very visual for me.
segments.cn: 现在，这对我来说是非常形象的。

segments.en: I see somebody sulking.
segments.cn: 我看到有人在闷闷不乐。

segments.en: Their head is low.
segments.cn: 他们的头低着。

segments.en: They're sad.
segments.cn: 他们很伤心。

segments.en: Someone who is sulking often wears their sweatpants or their pajamas.
segments.cn: 闷闷不乐的人通常穿着运动裤或睡衣。

segments.en: They don't make themselves look good.
segments.cn: 他们不让自己看起来好。

segments.en: To sulk around means to be in your house, to be sad, to watch TV and eat ice cream.
segments.cn: 闷闷不乐意味着待在家里，感到伤心，看电视和吃冰淇淋。

segments.en: So stop sulking.
segments.cn: 所以别再闷闷不乐了。

segments.en: Don't look sad.
segments.cn: 别看起来伤心。

segments.en: Be happy.
segments.cn: 要快乐。

segments.en: So to sulk is to act sad and to be very down.
segments.cn: 所以“闷闷不乐”就是表现得很伤心，情绪低落。

segments.en: So it's kind of like you're very... it's kind of a combination of being lazy and also sad at the same time because something bad happened to you.
segments.cn: 所以这有点像你非常……这有点像懒惰和伤心同时发生，因为你遇到了不好的事情。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: And so we often say that in English, teenagers like to sulk.
segments.cn: 所以我们常说，青少年喜欢闷闷不乐。

segments.en: You know, oh, I'm so angry at my parents.
segments.cn: 你知道，哦，我对我的父母很生气。

segments.en: And your parents will say, hey, stop sulking.
segments.cn: 你的父母会说，嘿，别闷闷不乐了。

segments.en: Go study.
segments.cn: 去学习吧。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: Very good.
segments.cn: 非常好。

segments.en: Okay, so a lot of great phrases here.
segments.cn: 好的，这里有很多很好的短语。

segments.en: I think we can go back.
segments.cn: 我觉得我们可以回去。

segments.en: Let's listen to this dialogue one last time.
segments.cn: 让我们最后再听一次这个对话。

segments.en: Hello?
segments.cn: 你好？

segments.en: Hey, do you want to go out tonight?
segments.cn: 嘿，你今晚想出去吗？

segments.en: No, I think I'll pass.
segments.cn: 不，我想我就不去了。

segments.en: Mark broke up with me.
segments.cn: 马克和我分手了。

segments.en: I feel awful.
segments.cn: 我感觉糟透了。

segments.en: What?
segments.cn: 什么？

segments.en: What happened?
segments.cn: 发生了什么？

segments.en: Just last week you were talking about going on vacation together.
segments.cn: 就在上周你还在谈论一起去度假呢。

segments.en: I don't know what I did wrong.
segments.cn: 我不知道我做错了什么。

segments.en: He said he needed some space to figure things out.
segments.cn: 他说他需要一些空间来理清事情。

segments.en: He said I didn't do anything wrong, that I'm a great person, just not the one for him.
segments.cn: 他说我没有做错任何事，我是个好人，只是对他来说不是合适的人。

segments.en: That's so cliche.
segments.cn: 这太老套了。

segments.en: Mark's not worth your time, Lydia.
segments.cn: 马克不值得你浪费时间，莉迪亚。

segments.en: You deserve so much better.
segments.cn: 你值得更好的。

segments.en: I know we had hit a rough patch, but I had hoped we could work it out next weekend when we both had some time off.
segments.cn: 我知道我们经历了一段困难时期，但我希望我们下周末能解决这个问题，当我们都有时间休息的时候。

segments.en: I think he found someone else.
segments.cn: 我觉得他找到了其他人。

segments.en: I had been getting suspicious because he had been spending a lot of time with a co-worker.
segments.cn: 我一直有些怀疑，因为他花了很多时间和一个同事在一起。

segments.en: Whatever.
segments.cn: 随便吧。

segments.en: He's a jerk.
segments.cn: 他是个混蛋。

segments.en: Forget about him.
segments.cn: 忘了他吧。

segments.en: There are many more fish in the sea.
segments.cn: 海里还有很多鱼。

segments.en: Talk about being cliche, Maggie.
segments.cn: 说到老套，玛吉。

segments.en: But, you're right.
segments.cn: 但，你说得对。

segments.en: There's no use for me to sulk around.
segments.cn: 我没有必要闷闷不乐。

segments.en: Let's go out tonight.
segments.cn: 今晚我们出去吧。

segments.en: It's not you, it's me.
segments.cn: 不是你，是我。

segments.en: You're just not the one.
segments.cn: 你只是对我来说不是那个人。

segments.en: I need some space.
segments.cn: 我需要一些空间。

segments.en: I think of you more like a friend.
segments.cn: 我把你当作朋友。

segments.en: Because there's a boyfriend or girlfriend, but then there's a friend.
segments.cn: 因为有男朋友或女朋友，但也有朋友。

segments.en: I like you, but I think of you more like a friend.
segments.cn: 我喜欢你，但我把你当作朋友。

segments.en: I think that's a typical one.
segments.cn: 我觉得这是一个典型的说法。

segments.en: Especially if you're asking someone out on a date, they might say, I really like you, but I see you more as a friend than anything else.
segments.cn: 尤其是如果你在约某人出去，他们可能会说，我真的很喜欢你，但我把你看作朋友多于其他。

segments.en: So there's another one that's very popular.
segments.cn: 所以还有另一个非常流行的说法。

segments.en: Sometimes you hear people say, I'm just not ready for a relationship.
segments.cn: 有时你会听到人们说，我只是还没有准备好进入一段关系。

segments.en: And that's also a cliche line.
segments.cn: 这也是一句老套的话。

segments.en: Or, I'm not ready to commit.
segments.cn: 或者，我还没有准备好承诺。

segments.en: I'm not ready to commit.
segments.cn: 我还没有准备好承诺。

segments.en: And it's interesting because I think breaking up is one of the hardest things that people can do.
segments.cn: 有趣的是，我认为分手是人们能做的最困难的事情之一。

segments.en: And I think maybe this is why you just use one of these phrases that are so popular and common.
segments.cn: 我觉得也许这就是为什么你会使用这些非常流行和常见的短语。

segments.en: Because I guess it's kind of a good way to explain in very soft terms what you want to say and to break up with someone.
segments.cn: 因为我想这是一种很好的方式，用非常温和的方式解释你想说的内容，并与某人分手。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: And I think that sometimes people are afraid to make the other person sad.
segments.cn: 我觉得有时人们害怕让对方伤心。

segments.en: And so they say these things that are very, you know, general.
segments.cn: 所以他们说这些非常……你知道的，笼统的话。

segments.en: Like, it's not you, it's me.
segments.cn: 比如说，不是你，是我。

segments.en: But sometimes this makes the other person even more sad because they don't understand why they're breaking up.
segments.cn: 但有时这会让对方更加伤心，因为他们不明白为什么会分手。

segments.en: What about breaking up over the telephone or breaking up with a letter?
segments.cn: 关于通过电话分手或写信分手呢？

segments.en: Generally, at least in America, we say that breaking up over email or letter or phone is not a good way to end a relationship.
segments.cn: 通常，至少在美国，我们说通过电子邮件、信件或电话分手不是结束一段关系的好方法。

segments.en: It's very cold.
segments.cn: 这非常冷漠。

segments.en: It's very cold.
segments.cn: 这非常冷漠。

segments.en: So the other person would be very angry if that happened.
segments.cn: 所以如果发生这种情况，另一方会非常生气。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: You just want to see the person and say, listen, let's have a conversation.
segments.cn: 你只是想见到对方，告诉他们，听着，我们来谈谈。

segments.en: Let's talk about this face to face.
segments.cn: 我们面对面谈谈这个。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: So this is actually very interesting because as we say, maybe in other countries or in other cultures, it's not really a negative thing to break up over the phone or maybe send an email saying, you know what, I don't want to see you anymore.
segments.cn: 这实际上很有趣，因为正如我们所说，也许在其他国家或文化中，通过电话分手或发送电子邮件说“我不想再见你了”并不算负面。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: So I'd be very curious to hear about you guys and your cultures and what happens when people break up where you live.
segments.cn: 我很想听听你们的文化，以及你们那里人们分手时发生了什么。

segments.en: So let us know.
segments.cn: 所以请告诉我们。

segments.en: Our website is EnglishPod.com.
segments.cn: 我们的网站是 EnglishPod.com。

segments.en: We hope to see you there.
segments.cn: 我们希望在那里见到你。

segments.en: And of course, we hope that you haven't had any very bad breakup experiences.
segments.cn: 当然，我们希望你们没有经历过非常糟糕的分手经历。

segments.en: But if you're comfortable sharing, we'd like to hear about your culture and your background.
segments.cn: 但如果你们愿意分享，我们想听听你们的文化和背景。

segments.en: All right.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: So we'll see you guys there.
segments.cn: 那么我们在那里见。

segments.en: Bye.
segments.cn: 再见。
